alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 8:19PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: .Moderate north wind over southern Lake Huron has elevating water level into the St Clair river with flow further restricted by ice. The wind speed and direction is expected to continue tonight through Friday morning leading additional water level rise and ice blockage flooding during this time. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE BLOCKAGE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice blockage continues. * WHERE...Along the St Clair River from the city of St Clair downstream to Algonac. * WHEN...Until noon EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM EST, Emergency management and river gages indicated flooding is expected due to north wind, ice restricted river flow, and ice blockages of the river. Flooding is likely for the rest of tonight through Friday morning. - River gauges have shown fluctuations in the river levels around the levels for minor flooding. This is expected to persist through the night as ice continues to flow down the river from Port Huron with ice blockages further downstream. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Clair, Algonac, Marine City and East China Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
